statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: De'Monte Buckingham scored 19 points with five 3-pointers and Khwan Fore distributed 12 assists and grabbed seven rebounds and Richmond pummeled Fordham 70-48 in Atlantic 10 play on Saturday.
article.headline: Richmond handles Fordham behind Buckingham in 70-48 win
article.linkText: Richmond handles Fordham behind Buckingham in 70-48 win
article.story: NEW YORK -- De'Monte Buckingham scored 19 points with five 3-pointers and Khwan Fore distributed 12 assists and grabbed seven rebounds and Richmond pummeled Fordham 70-48 in Atlantic 10 play on Saturday. Richmond (17-11, 11-5) remained tied for third in conference play with Rhode Island with one week left of the regular season. Marshall Wood's 3-pointer with 10:30 left before halftime put Richmond up 18-13, and the Spiders outscored Fordham 22-7 to end the half. The Rams' smallest deficit was 13 points in the second half. T.J. Cline scored 12 points on 6-for-10 shooting and ShawnDre' Jones chipped in 11 points for Richmond (17-11, 11-5). The Spiders were 27 for 54 from the field including 9 for 25 from 3-point range. The Spiders distributed 21 assists to just seven for Fordham. Antwoine Anderson led Fordham (13-16, 7-9) with 16 points.
